content.raw:
I managed to port all the latest mainline-labscript changes to our branch and would be able  test the remote workers. However I am not quite sure how to get it running.

I want to test it with the setup we currently use: We have a GPIB-card connected to one computer where remote\_worker is running on. I configure RemoteBLACS\(''GPIB\_remote\_worker', ‘192.168.1.41’\) in the connection table with the correct IP and specify in the device\_instance that it uses worker=GPIB\_remote\_worker.  
Now I get the error when compiling the connection table that the “worker” argument must be a subclass of \_RemoteConnection and I am not sure whether the problem is with the device class or with the implementation od remote worker.  
e.g.: Do I need a fully working connection table on the remote desktop or just at the “localhost”? Maybe you can add some more instructions.
content.html:
I managed to port all the latest mainline-labscript changes to our branch and would be able test the remote workers. However I am not quite sure how to get it running.

I want to test it with the setup we currently use: We have a GPIB-card connected to one computer where remote_worker is running on. I configure RemoteBLACS(''GPIB_remote_worker', ‘192.168.1.41’) in the connection table with the correct IP and specify in the device_instance that it uses worker=GPIB_remote_worker.
Now I get the error when compiling the connection table that the “worker” argument must be a subclass of _RemoteConnection and I am not sure whether the problem is with the device class or with the implementation od remote worker.
e.g.: Do I need a fully working connection table on the remote desktop or just at the “localhost”? Maybe you can add some more instructions.
